predicate.note: Frames file for 'log' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

example.name: arbitrary subject
example.text: They worried about an Interior Department directive [*] to log all communications with Members or their staffs .

example.name: passive
example.text: This means [0] Interior contacts can not be logged [*-1] only on one day -- a Sunday that [*T*-2] had already passed .

example.name: transitive
example.text: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. , the entity formed [*] from the recent acquisition of Squibb Corp. by Bristol-Myers Co. , logged the largest volume decline , 7,592,988 shares , to 12,017,724 .

the largest volume decline , 7,592,988 shares , to 12,017,724

roleset.name: to enter into a computer the information required to begin a session

example.name: intransitive
example.text: If it finds one and gets into the system , it will display a screen [*ICH*-1] when a user logs on [*T*-3] that [*T*-2] says , `` Worms Against Nuclear Killers ... .
